placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
text:
OK, the positives. Friendly staff, though several on the Reception appeared to be standing around with little to do.  We had an issue with our AirCon not working, which was a bit of an inconvenience as we had to swop rooms, but the maintenance team did sort it out overtnight. The garden is landscaped around several mature trees and the large pool, which has plenty of loungers, showers and a bar. 
The shower in our room was excellent - good power and heat. Beds hard, but very comfortable. We stayed 4 nights and the room was cleaned daily. Rooms have seating outside.  
Good access to the beach via a private path and several places to have a drink or some food are close by. The nearest, YOUR CHOICE, plays loud music all day so not exactly relaxing if you are using the Anantamaa beach loungers, but at night you can sit nearer the surf on the beach, which softens the noise. The next place down the beach (towards Trincomalee), THE 18th HOLE, had a fun, younger vibe with different stalls offering everything from sushi to burgers, pizza to tacos. Sushi was excellent. A little further down the beach was WAVES restaurant, which did some great fish/seafood, but choice of fish was limited. 
Negatives: The hotel just looks a little tired and really needs updating.  A little more attention to some details and some investment would go a long way. 
Our room was basic - some fitted wardrobes, but only a handful of hangers. No bedside lamp and little decoration on the walls. Felt a bit soulless, but it was clean. 
Breakfast was typical fare, but really  basic and not particularly appetising. Dry pastries and dreadful coffee. 4 days and the same options every day.  It was no big surprise to see that the restaurant was almost empty every night we were there - guests were obviously choosing to dine elsewhere.
The fish ponds surrounding the pool area are green and smelt stagnant - they were so murky, you can only just see the fish swimming in them. Some oxygen and a regular clean is necessary.  The pool area is great, but the bar staff play music for much of the day, the choice of which seems more for their benefit than the guests.  Looking at the guests around the pool (almost entirely elderly and families with young kids) something a little more chilled would have been preferable. The loud beat and tinny sound from the music stopped us relaxing by the pool - otherwise it could have been a tranquil place to relax.  
We were moved to a different room as our AirCon was not working. The replacement room was substandard - the bathroom door was so warped it would not close and the wardrobe door was missing. The shower had weak flow. We asked to be moved back to our original room once the AirCon was fixed, . 
There was also a wedding or party one night we were there, which took place in a function room above guest suites, so we had to endure loud base until 11.30pm. No warning of this, nor any apology when we complained to Reception. 
There is a designated beach area for the sole use of Anantamaa guests, bit it had limited sun loungers and you need to get there early to secure one. There were only four parasols and one was blown away by the wind and removed by staff, never to return.  There had obviously been an effort to clean up all the plastic rubbish from the sand, but it was just left in a big pile next to the loungers, which pretty much summed up the general feel of the hotel.
title: With some investment and updating, it could be so much better.

Take some time off the beach and take a Tuk-Tuk tour with Kajan to see Trincomalee.
I recommend the Sunrise Temple tour and Harbour Sunset.
text:
The location is fantastic, as previously mentioned and rooms have terraces, which are a great place to sit and relax with a cold beer.

We arranged a Tuk-Tuk tour with Kajan from the Cottages and he showed us around the area, which was really interesting to get off the beach and see the local life and culture in Trincomalee.

text:
We booked Trinco Blu for 3 days and had a lovely stay. Check-in was smooth and we were given lovely cold cinnamon welcome drinks on arrival. We stayed in room 402, which offered both pool and sea views. The direct access to the beach was great and we enjoyed being able to step out onto the beach at anytime. The beach was clean, there were plenty of sunbeds available and the pool/beach staff were very helpful in providing beach towels and sunbed mattresses. We were also able to order drinks that were brought over to us on the beach. We enjoyed lovely sunrise and evening walks along the beach. The breakfast and dinner buffets had a wide variety and we enjoyed our meals during our stay. We also had lunch at The Crab twice and the food and drinks were very good. The staff in both restaurants were friendly and accommodating. 

The hotel needs updating as some parts look tired and worn out, including the mirrors behind the reception desks, this is important for first impressions. Although there is a light natural breeze at the entrance, ceiling fans would help keep the area and guests cooler when checking-in and out. Housekeeping is offered twice daily, which is helpful given the mess that can come into your room following an afternoon at the beach. We personally wouldn't have minded if the room had a broom, so we could sweep up sand etc. after ourselves rather than wait for housekeeping later in the day. A mat or towel by the beach entrance door would also be good to wipe your feet after rinsing off before stepping into your room. The ceiling shower and toiletries were good, we felt it would have been useful to also have a handheld shower to rinse off the shower area once finished. The bins in the room and bathroom were rusty and could easily be replaced. We found the live music at dinner to be a little loud and not to everyone's taste. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful when needed. We will definitely return to Trinco Blu and would recommend to family and friends.
title: Lovely stay at Trinco Blu

Reception &checkin- A smiling and warm reception, cold and sweet passion fruit welcome drink, checkin smooth. Rated 5 on a scale of 1-5
Room- small compact room, little crowded, first floor, sea facing, quite airy, very effective Aircon, Tea coffee maker with sachets. Sitting are outside the room with two chairs, small table, and a lying down cushion. Rated 4.5
Bathroom- a large bathroom and an open air shower. Basics provided in the bathroom (bottled shampoo, shower gel and body lotion) , warm tab provides lukewarm water only. Rated-4

Hospitality and Service- A very polite and service oriented staff. A special mention of Pratheep and Ursula at the reception. Rated- 5
Overall rating- overall I will rate Trincomalee Blu at 4.7 out of five. 
Suggestions for travellers: Dolphin watching is fun especially when you are with kids but don‚Äôt fall for the random guy who reaches you on the sea shore and offers cheap price. Always reach out to the hotel and book from them, though expensive but suggested for safety and other reasons.

text:
My husband and I came here as a treat to ourselves. As non expatriate locals living in Sri Lanka the half board price was pretty steep for us. But we indulged and splurged as the place looked amazing. As did the ocean

TRINCO BLU didnt fail to disappoint 
Firstly the superior room was very well maintained, clean and had a great view and ambience similar to the hotel. Very relaxed vibes. Pool was well equipped with showers, towels and constantly kept clean. Beach was similarly upkept with no touts and pristine white sand. Blessed with an ocean of dreams. I've never seen a sea more blue where you could wade out to calm waters for miles. 

Buffet of dinner and breakfast were top class. 10/10 Cinnamon! Me being a foodie i have to say the variety was unmatchable. we had delicious crab, squid, fish and a variety of meat preparations. International buffet with Indian western and fabulous traditional Eastern province local preparations. Breakfast on a Thursday had freshly made hoppers pol rotti and even a fabulous "Diya Buth". Apart from the traditional English breakfast specials there was an area traditional sweet milk rice as well. Very large and lavish spread!

Last but not least staff hospitality was excellent. From reception to dining staff everyone was courteous and accommodative. We checked out on Friday at 12pm and hung around for our train till 7pm. We were even given a proper room space for the ten min of prayers we required without shoving us into an odd corner. This I thought was next level. In a hotel at capacity bookings with foreign guests the care shown to the few locals was truly commendable. Much respect and love.

It must be mentioned the Live music singer was one of the best iv heard, singing local songs and a vocal range covering Guns & Roses, Michael Jackson and Bob Marley!

I would definitely save up to return again. 9.5/10 rating. This is definitely the best hotel in Trinco. If you are visiting Sri Lanka take it from a local with fairly stringent standards, Trinco blu surpasses expectations. Couldn't find a better hotel for genuine sri lankan warmth and quality refinement in hospitality üëå
title: Nothing short off TrincoBlu in the East!

Unfortunately, in my opinion, this hotel did not live up to all of the 5* the reviews. In contrast to every other hotel we visited in Sri Lanka (we had stayed in 6 prior to this hotel) the management at this hotel was absent! The junior suite was very spacious and the beds were comfortable but like the hotel, the room lacked any type of character. The AC unit in the room was it working when we arrived and neither were several of the power sockets.  Once reported, the management promptly sent out an engineer who managed to fix everything. The AC went off again the next night due to a powercut but the back up generator did not kick in for several hours as we were woken up at 5am by the heat! 
The bathroom was rather dated and the towels were not white and fluffy but an off white colour and fraying at the edges (and one had holes).  The pathway to the rooms were also in need of repair with cracked tiles in  several places. 
The pool is a good size but the sunbeds are old and quite rickety.   
Breakfast was ok and buffet style with a mixture of both Sri Lankan and western options. Lunch and dinner however were al la carte and they were both very good, serving some of the best food we had during our stay in Sri Lanka.
